text: Géla Babluani () (born 1979) is a Georgian–French film director. Babluani was born in Tbilisi, son of prominent director Temur Babluani.Reverse Shot At 17 years of age, he and his three siblings were sent to study in France. His first short film, A Fleur de Peau (2002), received critical appraise. His first feature-length film is 13 Tzameti, won the World Cinema Jury Prize for a Dramatic motion picture at the Sundance Film Festival. In 2006 he directed the film L'héritage with his father about several people from France who visit Tbilissi for an inheritance.Cinema Strikes Back In 2010 he completed an American version of 13 Tzameti titled 13. ==Filmography== *13 (2010) *L'héritage (2006) directed with his father Temur Babluani *13 Tzameti (2005) *À fleur de peau (2002), short film ==References== *Cineurope Interview (01/2006) ==External links== * *NYTimes Review of 13 Tzameti Category:1979 births Category:Georgian emigrants to France Category:European Film Awards winners (people) Category:French film directors Category:Film directors from Georgia (country) Category:Living people Category:Film people from Tbilisi Category:Svan people
title: Géla Babluani
